comment: This course requires a lot of reading but this professor does not know anything about the topic, so she grades by a few things and we all pass the class. It's a pity that she is the only one who teaches this course, so I am stuck with her this semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: She is so difficult to understand as English is not her first language. She spends too much time lecturing and does not do enough demonstration because she really does not know graphic design that well. She has favorites. Overall she does not seem to care if you learn or not. Most of us have small groups where we learn from each other. Run!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Kim is one of the most difficult professors I have ever had. She has no respect for students' time and can be quite rude at times. Makes you do an unnecessary amount of busy work for projects and will change guidelines without informing students. Although you do a lot of work your final project will be useful for your portfolio.

Absolutely do not recommend this professor. Unclear grading criteria, unkind attitude at times, harsh grader, challenging accent, sparse and contradicting online/verbal instruction, HEAVY workload, no visual/student examples, and poor feedback. It has been a very difficult semester in her class for all these reasons, take anyone else if possible.

I took her class because she was the only one who taught it. If you have other options, take them. I cannot emphasize this enough. I considered graduating late so that I didn't have to take her. She does not give feedback and is incredibly rude and inconsiderate of your personal life. Takes off points just because she feels like it. RUN!

Fairly straightforward class during the summer, small paper, fun projects for each unit, and tests are simple if you study. I enjoyed it and think Professor Kim did a great job with proctoring this course while being out of country.

Kristine is a nice professor but hard to understand because of her English. For a six week class we had a few items to be graded and they were too easy for an upper-level History course. I don't think that she knows much art history so she made the course quick and easy. I did not learn much about the history of graphic design.

This was one of the easiest classes I've taken because the professor did not really offer much. It was clear that she did not know the subject very well. This course has a lot of history and for six weeks I don't think that enough was covered. Although I got a good grade I really cannot say I feel I've learned much.

There isn't a lot of work, with there only being 3 projects/3 quizzes. But it's hard to find clear deadlines since she'll have 2-3 dates listed. She's also hard to get in contact with and doesn't answer emails for a while. Overall, an easy 6-week class with not much work, but confusing on the deadlines.

The class began for the summer and I'm already regretting it, but there is no one else teaching it. Plus she is teaching the only 2 sections offered. I think they should have another teacher for another section so students can have a choice. I want to drop this class already but I cannot afford to wait until Fall. Students need to have choices.

Organization is all over the place. Assignments are laundry lists of embedded links and rabbit holes. Each "project" has 18+ components, all need to be submitted in various ways. D2L grades are ZEROs so your final grade will look like 6% when she inputs the first grade. No way to tell if you're missing an assignment or if it's just not due yet. RUN

English is not her first language and can be difficult to understand. She does not know as much about web design as the other professors who teach it. I took her class because I heard that she is easy and gives a lot of extra credit to help with your grade. She is a nice person but not a very good teacher. I left her class not knowing much web.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: OMG! Professor Hwang Kim needs to teach. She gives extra credit and does not answer emails until it's too late. Stay far away from taking this course with her. She is a nice person but should not be teaching.

Kristine Hwang is one of the weakest professors in the art department. She is soft spoken and does not speak English very well, so it can be difficult to follow her instruction. Take another professor for Web Design.

This course was not in the Course Code area. This was an upper level art history course (ARH 4890) and this professor knows nothing about the history of graphic design, plus she is not a graphic designer. Why is she teaching this upper level course? Plus she is not an English speaker. Stay away!!! She does not know how to teach this course.

At the end of this course I  could not create a website which is what this course was about. Professor was learning the materials at the same time she was teaching it to us. We all struggled and had to ask other professors who were more web savvy for help. I have no idea why she teaches this course as there are more qualified professors.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: Nice professor but she send us on YouTube to search for videos to learn the course material. She might know the programs but she just has a hard time explaining because she does not speak English very well. I feel like I wasted my money taking this course with her. She needs to learn how to teach and not give extra credit to get a good grade.

This professor is terrible. She does not care about you or your work whatsoever. She shows it by giving no feedback on any of your assignments, meaning critiques are useless, and everything is graded last minute. Do yourself a favor and take a different class/teacher. If you have to take her, make sure you have enough time to prioritize her class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: I only made an A because I already knew had to use adobe programs. She did not help with anything. She should not be getting paid to do her job. All she does is grade your work, which takes days/weeks for her to give you. Dont take her unless you are a self learner. I had to take this class, and she was the only option this semester. RUN

She taught me NOTHING. All she did was post terrible youtube videos for us to learn and a website/online book we had to buy had photoshop, illustrator, and indesign tutorials to do. Her quizes are trick questions, she gives little to no feedback on what she wants on projects. She is weeks behind on grading. DONT TAKE HER

STAY AWAY! Her online class was MISERABLE. She grades very harshly and doesn't even follow her own grading criteria. Gives nonsensical feedback on roughs and "teaches" through YT videos. Basically a DIY course. If you want an A, you're going to have to put 15+ hours a week into her projects. Has no respect for students personal time and life. awful
This professor does not teach. She assigns work from the book and once you complete it you get a grade, so you can learn the material without going to a class. A waste of money.
Professor Hwang knows her content but her teaching is not as good. She can be hard to understand as English is not her first language. She really struggles in explaining but overall she is caring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Kim isnt the worst teacher ever, but beware if youre taking her online class, ESPECIALLY the asynchronous kind. I was basically teaching myself with a bit of help from her (often disorangized) power points and recorded lectures. I've heard she's better in in-person classes but if you aren't well-acquainted with things like ps don't take her online

I took Prof. Kim for a 6-week online synchronous session. She's a sweet person, works with students individually after class if they need it, & replies to emails quickly. Her demonstrations can be a bit fast-paced at times but she recorded them for later viewing and went over things again if we didn't understand them. I really enjoyed her class!

This was an odd class. All the learning is done through the tutorials and the teacher uploads very bland "instructional" videos where she basically just reads aloud what is already on D2L. I can't say that I feel like there even was an instructor for this course, it might as well have been a robot. All instructions were from YouTube or textbook.

I had to take Professor Kim's class for my art major and it was online. Biggest regret of my life. I'm sure she would be wonderful teaching face to face class, but she cannot teach. Her directions are confusing and she's a really, really tough grader.

interesting class. Prof. Kim did not really teach the class bc it's online. It was confusing at times, but I trucked through and so can you, be sure you do have a group me, your classmates will be ur best friends. If anyone needs the 2021 book email me cvicos (with the students kennesaw URL) i cant link it LOL
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I took Prof. Kim's online ART2550, and all I can say is SHEESH.. Prof. Kim seems like a nice person, however, not a good teacher. She did not teach the class at all and her grading is all over the place. Her "instructions" are unclear and she assigns hw over the weekend. You never get a break. BE SURE you have a group me. classmates r ur best bet.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: We basically had to open our book and follow the instructions for our assignment. It was an easy class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Terrible. Ive had to take her so many times and every class gets more vague and disorganized. In four projects weve had one clear guideline with set deadlines, and she seems to not know what shes teaching. Doesnt respond to emails. Ill likely have to take another web design course in the future.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Took her for the 6 week summer class. The class is not a hard class at all for 6 weeks and she is a good teacher with clear instructions on the projects. Her accent is not bad at all and is willing to work with students. Regardless of in the summer or fall/spring I reccomend her for computer applications
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She is nice, cares about us. I took the summer 6 wk. Class is expensive. Had to purchase Adobe photoshop, illustrator, InDesign PLUS projects have to be printed/matted in MAC lab. Tbh I went to fedex everytime printed on glossy paper. sometimes used black poster board to mount and I got an 89 in the class. never failed anything except the final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Hwang really cares for her students. I started this semester-6 week summer course. very skeptical due to never having used photoshop/illustrator before. Each lesson has a tutorial from the text. She gives a lecture usually and we work together. 3 quizzes and no exam. Every project has to be printed in MAC lab and matted gets expensive
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Her class is easy, but I have a disability that prevents me from going to class regularly and it was such a struggle to get her to comply with the accommodation requests I had officially through the school. Even though it's super easy to do the work at home and attendance isn't necessary to learn, she still grades heavily on it.

There was a wide variety of different projects with different techniques for each one. Project guidelines were clear.  Professor Hwang treated students with respect. She was excited to see students learn  and improve their skills.

If you are not familiar with Adobe, it will be difficult. The professor is a really nice person and always helps even when she is not supposed to. There are 5 projects during the semester and each of them requires a lot of homework. Again, if you know Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign and not missing the deadlines it will be an easy A.

She never emails back on ANYTHING. I have emailed her probably 15 times throughout the semester with important questions and received only 1 response. She is somewhat picky in what she wants for each project, but she grades pretty fairly.
This class has to be a regular class no online class. It is so confusing. She is not responding on emails on time. It is hard online class to have a group project.

She is very good at giving helpful criticism and improving your work ethic. She is very knowledgeable and grades very fairly. She shows that she cares about the students and really helps us learn the content through lectures and one-on-one help.

Show up or fail. Gives A's but is super nit-picky & wishy-washy about what she likes. Ex: Tells you to add color during rough print, takes points off on the final product because of too much color. She only likes what she likes, so you're basically a graphic design workshop for her. Didn't learn much except for how to use InDesign and typefaces.

Prof. Hwang care genuinely about her students and really wants to see us succeed. Her accent isn't bad or hard to understand like mentioned in the comments below. If you put enough work and effort into her class, you will get a good grade!
She is very nice and supportive of your ideas. I appreciated the consistency in dates regarding progress grades and also the ability to better a project.

She's not a good professor for the class she teaches. She's a nice person but a terrible professor. She's not clear on assignments, had us turn them in out of order, is extremely hands off & to top it off is difficult to understand, we also moved way too fast. I spent my time in class terribly confused & unprepared for the daily work load.

she is wonderful professor, it was hard class to deal with if you do not know about design computer soft ware though, in the end, because of her!! I learned a lot!! about Photoshop, Indesign and illustrator!!

Mrs. Hwang is a very sweet lady.  Because of her accent, it sometimes becomes a little diffuclt to hear and keep up with her lectures.  But overall, she does a good job of explaining what she wants out of her projects and how to go about them.  She grades very fairly, and really does want to see ALL of her students pass!
